filmography.title: Outward Bound
filmography.role_description: A cynical, alcoholic passenger on a mysterious ocean liner who realizes he and his fellow travelers are dead.
filmography.plot: A group of strangers find themselves on a ship with no crew, slowly discovering they are traveling to the afterlife.

filmography.title: Never the Twain Shall Meet
filmography.role_description: A strait-laced businessman who falls in love with a South Sea islander, leading to a cultural clash.
filmography.plot: A businessman travels to the South Seas and falls for a native girl, complicating his life back in San Francisco.

filmography.title: A Free Soul
filmography.role_description: The upper-crust, refined fiancé of a lawyer's daughter who is cast aside for a rough gangster.
filmography.plot: A defense attorney's daughter falls for the gangster her father got acquitted, leading to tragedy.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor (Lionel Barrymore Won)

filmography.title: Five and Ten
filmography.role_description: A young architect who becomes the object of affection for a wealthy heiress in this romantic drama.
filmography.plot: The daughter of a dime-store tycoon falls for an architect, but their romance is threatened by social climbing and infidelity.

filmography.title: Devotion
filmography.role_description: A barrister who unknowingly employs a woman in love with him as his governess.
filmography.plot: A woman disguises herself as a middle-aged governess to work for the man she loves.

filmography.title: Service for Ladies
filmography.role_description: A head waiter who falls in love with a socialite and masquerades as a prince to win her heart.
filmography.plot: A waiter follows a wealthy woman to the Swiss Alps, posing as royalty to court her.

filmography.title: Smilin' Through
filmography.role_description: A wealthy man haunted by the murder of his bride on their wedding day, who tries to control his niece's life.
filmography.plot: A woman falls in love with the son of the man who accidentally killed her guardian's fiancée years earlier.

filmography.title: The Animal Kingdom
filmography.role_description: A publisher torn between his free-spirited artist mistress and his manipulative, socially ambitious wife.
filmography.plot: A man leaves his bohemian lifestyle and mistress to marry a socialite, but finds he is trapped in a soulless marriage.

filmography.title: Secrets
filmography.role_description: A pioneer who elopes with a wealthy woman to the American West, building a life through hardship and success.
filmography.plot: An elderly woman recounts her life story, from eloping to the American West to building a fortune with her husband.

filmography.title: Captured!
filmography.role_description: A British officer in a German POW camp whose wife falls in love with his best friend.
filmography.plot: Prisoners of war in a German camp during WWI deal with escape plans and romantic betrayals back home.

filmography.title: Berkeley Square
filmography.role_description: A modern man who travels back in time to 18th-century London and falls in love with his ancestor.
filmography.plot: A young American is transported back to London in the time of the American Revolution and meets his ancestors.

filmography.title: Of Human Bondage
filmography.role_description: A club-footed medical student who becomes obsessively enslaved by his love for a cruel, manipulative waitress.
filmography.plot: A young medical student falls obsessively in love with a callous waitress who repeatedly rejects and uses him.

filmography.title: The Lady Is Willing
filmography.role_description: A French detective who kidnaps a woman to hold her ransom but ends up falling in love with her.
filmography.plot: A detective creates a fake kidnapping scheme to recoup his money from a swindler, but romance complicates the plan.

filmography.title: British Agent
filmography.role_description: A British diplomat in Russia during the Bolshevik Revolution who falls for a female revolutionary.
filmography.plot: A British diplomat tries to prevent a separate peace between Russia and Germany while romancing a Soviet agent.

filmography.title: The Scarlet Pimpernel
filmography.role_description: The definitive portrayal of the foppish English aristocrat who secretly rescues French nobles from the guillotine.
filmography.plot: A mysterious English nobleman rescues aristocrats from the French Revolution while posing as a dim-witted fop in society.

filmography.title: The Petrified Forest
filmography.role_description: A disillusioned, wandering intellectual who finds meaning in sacrifice when held hostage by a gangster.
filmography.plot: A drifting intellectual and a gangster on the run cross paths at a lonely diner in the Arizona desert.

filmography.title: Romeo and Juliet
filmography.role_description: An older, more cerebral Romeo in George Cukor's lavish production of the Shakespeare tragedy.
filmography.plot: The Montagues and Capulets feud in Verona while their children Romeo and Juliet fall in love.

filmography.title: It's Love I'm After
filmography.role_description: An egotistical stage actor who tries to disillusion a young fan to save her engagement, with comedic results.
filmography.plot: A stage couple's relationship is tested when a young fan falls in love with the actor, leading to a scheme to disenchant her.

filmography.title: Stand-In
filmography.role_description: A stuffy Wall Street mathematician sent to Hollywood to save a failing movie studio.
filmography.plot: A number-crunching banker is sent to Hollywood to assess a studio and learns that the movie business defies logic.

filmography.title: Pygmalion
filmography.role_description: The arrogant phonetics professor who bets he can transform a Cockney flower girl into a duchess.
filmography.plot: A phonetics professor attempts to teach a Cockney flower girl to speak proper English and pass as a lady in high society.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Venice Film Festival: Win – Volpi Cup

filmography.title: Intermezzo
filmography.role_description: A world-famous violinist who leaves his family for a passionate affair with his daughter's piano teacher.
filmography.plot: A famous violinist falls in love with his daughter's piano teacher, leading him to leave his family for an idyll in Europe.

filmography.title: Gone with the Wind
filmography.role_description: The honorable, intellectual Southern gentleman who is the object of Scarlett O'Hara's obsession.
filmography.plot: A manipulative woman and a roguish man conduct a turbulent romance during the American Civil War and Reconstruction periods.

filmography.title: 49th Parallel
filmography.role_description: An effete British writer living in the Canadian wilderness who finds his courage when confronted by escaping Nazis.
filmography.plot: A U-boat crew are stranded in northern Canada and must make their way to the border while evading capture.

filmography.title: 'Pimpernel' Smith
filmography.role_description: A mild-mannered archaeology professor who secretly rescues victims of the Nazis in pre-WWII Germany.
filmography.plot: An eccentric professor leads a group of students to Germany to rescue prisoners from the Nazis.

filmography.title: The First of the Few
filmography.role_description: The visionary aircraft designer who races against time and illness to create the Spitfire fighter plane; Howard's final film role.
filmography.plot: The story of the man who designed the Supermarine Spitfire fighter aircraft, which helped win the Battle of Britain.
